* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").

* is normally generated [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful").

| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   | [monst.c#line2385](/wiki/Monst.c#line2385 "Monst.c")            |

The **prisoner**, @, is a monster that rarely appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. Prisoners are found only in jail cells on some [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") levels, such as the [Tourist quest](/wiki/Tourist_quest "Tourist quest") or [Wizard quest](/wiki/Wizard_quest "Wizard quest").

## Strategy

Freeing a prisoner can give an [alignment bonus](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record"); although you may anger the guards, they will likely already be hostile to you at that point.

## Encyclopedia entry

 Where am I?  
   In the Village.  
 What do you want?  
   Information.  
 Whose side are you on?  
   That would be telling. We want  
   information ...  
   information ...  
 You won't get it.  
   By hook or by crook, we will.  
 Who are you?  
   The new Number 2.  
 Who is Number 1?  
   You are Number 6.  
 I am not a number! I am a free man!

  


The Prisoner, by Patrick McGoohan

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Prisoner\&action=edit)*

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-343}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
Prisoner

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
@ prisoner
Difficulty 14
Attacks Projectile as weapon, or if in range, uses melee weapon for 1d6
@ prisoner
Difficulty 14
Attacks

Projectile as weapon, or if in range, uses melee weapon for 1d6

Base level 12
Base experience 272
Speed 12
Base AC 10
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size Medium
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A prisoner:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a human.
  • is normally generated peaceful.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • lets you close unless attacked.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference monst.c#line2385

The prisoner, @, is a monster that rarely appears in NetHack. Prisoners are found only in jail cells on some quest levels, such as the Tourist quest or Wizard quest.

Strategy

Freeing a prisoner can give an alignment bonus; although you may anger the guards, they will likely already be hostile to you at that point.

Encyclopedia entry

 Where am I?
   In the Village.
 What do you want?
   Information.
 Whose side are you on?
   That would be telling. We want
   information ...
   information ...
 You won't get it.
   By hook or by crook, we will.
 Who are you?
   The new Number 2.
 Who is Number 1?
   You are Number 6.
 I am not a number! I am a free man!


The Prisoner, by Patrick McGoohan

The '''prisoner''', {{monsym|prisoner}}, is a monster that rarely appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. Prisoners are found only in jail cells on some [[quest]] levels, such as the [[Tourist quest]] or [[Wizard quest]].

==Strategy==
Freeing a prisoner can give an [[alignment record|alignment bonus]]; although you may anger the guards, they will likely already be hostile to you at that point.

==Encyclopedia entry==

{{encyclopedia|<poem>
 Where am I?
   In the Village.
 What do you want?
   Information.
 Whose side are you on?
   That would be telling. We want
   information ...
   information ...
 You won't get it.
   By hook or by crook, we will.
 Who are you?
   The new Number 2.
 Who is Number 1?
   You are Number 6.
 I am not a number! I am a free man!
</poem>|The Prisoner, by Patrick McGoohan}}
